item.title: The UAE has a strong presence in LinkedIn's list of the top 100 most sought-after employers in EMEA for 2015
item.description:
Source: LinkedIn blog. LinkedIn has released its list of the 100 Most In-Demand Employers in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa for 2015. These rankings, showcasing the most sought-after companies in the region, are based on a comprehensive analysis of billions of professional interactions with companies on the LinkedIn platform. Nine companies from the UAE, the only Middle Eastern nation represented, secured a spot on the list. Emirates claimed sixth place, followed by Saudi Aramco (15th), Etihad (20th), Emaar (27th), and Etisalat (30th)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-uae-has-a-strong-presence-in-linkedin-s-list-of-the-top-100-most-sought-after-employers-in-emea-for-2015/

item.title: The APAC region is strongly featured in Warc's list of the top 100 marketing campaigns
item.description:
Warc, a provider of marketing intelligence, has introduced the Warc 100, a new ranking of the top marketing campaigns globally based on their effectiveness and strategic impact. The Asia Pacific region contributed over 30 entries, including one from the UAE, with Australia having the second-highest representation after the US with 11 entries. Among the top 10 campaigns from the Asia Pacific are: “It’s More Fun in the Philippines” by the Philippines Department of Tourism and BBDO Guerrero (ranked 3rd), “Overstay Checkout” by Art Series Hotels and Naked Communications (5th), “Smoking Kid” by Thai Health Promotion Foundation and Ogilvy & Mather (7th), “Old Parts for New” by ORBIS International and Ogilvy & Mather (8th), and “Car Creation” by NRMA Insurance and Whybin\TBWA (10th)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-apac-region-is-strongly-featured-in-warc-s-list-of-the-top-100-marketing-campaigns/

item.title: Singapore's Influential Brands are identified by Gen X
item.description:
Singapore’s Leading Brands Chosen by Generation X A consumer-driven award program spearheaded by Brand Alliance has identified the top Influential Brands in Singapore, as determined by the upwardly mobile Generation X (Gen X) demographic. Source: Brand Alliance. Brand Alliance presented the 2013 Influential Brands awards in November 2013. The 2014 Influential Brands conference is scheduled for November 10, 2014. The survey highlighted over 100 prominent brands resonating with consumers in Singapore...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singapore-s-influential-brands-are-identified-by-gen-x/
